nodes.text:
The guard shack sits off the approach road like it was placed by a committee that feared weather and people equally.
The door has a steel pull handle. The card reader beside it glows faintly, as if embarrassed to be awake.

choices.text: Look at the guard shack door.
Use the call box speaker and button.
Look at the pneumatic tube label plate.

nodes.text:
The door is closed flush. The latch side shows fresh wear where someone tested it recently and stopped.
No gap, no give. It’s locked.

The reader’s indicator is on, but the light is thin and unstable, like it’s being rationed.
A strip of tape under it reads: “TEMP POWER — DO NOT RELY.”

A brass plate, scuffed to dull gold, sits beside a capped tube port.
It’s labeled in block letters: “FORMS — INTAKE / OUTBOUND — DO NOT SEND FOOD.”
Someone scratched an arrow under “OUTBOUND” like they didn’t trust the printed one.

You present your badge. The reader chirps once—polite, hopeful—then the light drops to a dim pulse.
The lock doesn’t actuate.
A second later the reader resets itself, as if it can’t admit it tried.
The speaker pops. A breath. Then a voice that sounds like it’s already composing an email about this.

External Assurance line three—no, sorry. (pause) The box still labels it “Guard.” (pause) Go ahead. (pause) State your purpose in a sentence. (pause) Two if you must. (pause) It helps with comparability.

choices.text: Ask: “I need access to the shack.”
Persuade: “I’m OLEA. Give me the actual access path.”
Ask: “Confirm for the record: locked door, reader can log but not actuate.”

nodes.text:
Access isn't one action. (pause) It's chain of custody. (pause)
If you mean entry, (pause) it's governed by the site's mothball status. (pause)
That's operational posture. (pause) Not abandonment.

So the correct first step is (pause) confirm access control can log a record. (pause) Try your badge. (pause) If it fails, don’t repeat more than twice. (pause) Repetition implies expectation. (pause) Expectation implies a test. (pause) Tests imply scope.
The speaker waits with the patience of a form.
Underpowered is a strong word.(pause) I'd say “intermittently energized.”(pause) Consistent with mothball.(pause) Mothball isn't off.(pause) It's minimized.
It may authenticate without actuating, yes. (pause) That’s actually preferable for us. (pause) Authentication creates a timestamp. (pause) Actuation creates liability.
Static crackles, like someone shuffling papers.

“On-site” is geographic. (pause)
“Present” is procedural. (pause)
No staffed guard function. (pause)
If that’s what you’re asking. (pause)
Staffing was removed under the continuity amendment. (pause)
Because the facility was considered stable.

Stable as in “not moving.” (pause) Not stable as in “safe.” (pause) Different column. (pause)
Assurance is remote. (pause) Contracted by your funders, not your office. (pause) So we don’t muddle authority. (pause)
I document deviations. (pause) I don’t authorize solutions.
The call box hums, faintly pleased to be useful.

I hear you, (pause) I’m not disputing your badge color. (pause) But “actual access path” implies one sanctioned route. (pause) If I say it aloud it’s discoverable. (pause) So I can confirm what’s not available. (pause) For your record.

There is no on-site attendant. (pause) There is no remote door release. (pause) The reader is budgeted to log attempts. (pause) Not to drive the strike. (pause) So it’s “intermittently energized.” (pause) If you need entry, use another mechanism. (pause) Not the reader.

Like a work order. (pause) Like a keyed override. (pause) It may or may not exist. (pause) Where the signage claims it exists. (pause) Like—my personal favorite—routing your need. (pause) Through the pneumatic system, because then it (pause) becomes paper. (pause) And everyone relaxes.
The speaker clicks softly, as if it’s smiling.
I can’t validate authority from a call box. (pause) Want this to be actionable? (pause) Phrase it as an observation I can log. (pause) Not an instruction I can transmit.

Confirmed as stated: door state is locked. (pause) The reader’s power posture supports logging attempts. (pause) Reliable actuation is not supported. (pause) This boundary is acceptable for outside documentation.
The line disconnects cleanly. You’re left with the door, the weak light, and a conversation that will outlive you in a folder.
